definition: to be willing/to be satisfied
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]
surname Gan/abbr. for Gansu Province 甘肅省|甘肃省[Gan1 su4 Sheng3]
sweet/willing
delighted to (do sth, idiom)/perfectly happy to do/most willing to do

sentences.english: Love is a sweet tyranny, because the lover endures his torment willingly.
sentences.chinese: 愛情是甜蜜的虐政，情人心甘情願地受它的折磨。

sentences.english: As a consequence, people willingly and wholeheartedly give themselves to what she asks of them.
sentences.chinese: 因此，人們心甘情願地全心全意地聽從她的請求。

sentences.english: Why is knowing that fate has done, but also willing to love you?
sentences.chinese: 爲何明知緣分已盡，還心甘情願的愛着你？

sentences.english: Love eis a sweet tyranny, because the lover endures his torment willingly.
sentences.chinese: 愛情是甜蜜的虐政，情人心甘情願地受它的折磨。

sentences.english: Then there's the fact that Obasanjo has never really willingly stepped aside.
sentences.chinese: 而且有事實證明奧巴桑喬從未真正心甘情願地讓過賢。

sentences.english: I owed him some favors, so I did so of my own accord.
sentences.chinese: 我欠他一些人情，因此我心甘情願這樣做。

sentences.english: " And "Italy is a little pervert who has become Russia's willing bitch!"
sentences.chinese: 意大利是個墮落的小賤人，心甘情願被俄羅斯使喚。

sentences.english: Many people, even youth, were willing to sacrifice themselves for him.
sentences.chinese: 許多人，甚至是年輕人都心甘情願地爲他出生入死。

sentences.english: Perhaps, love is willing to pay the share, close-knit.
sentences.chinese: 或許，愛就是心甘情願的付出，甘苦與共的分享。

sentences.english: Be sensitive to her feelings and be willing to apologize.
sentences.chinese: 對她的感受要敏感並心甘情願地道歉。

sentences.english: Unless, that is, you agree willingly to let me do it again, and no handkerchief.
sentences.chinese: 除非你心甘情願地讓我再吻一次，而且不許用手絹擦。

sentences.english: Paris,--let us confess it--willingly allows infamy to furnish it with comedy.
sentences.chinese: 我們應該承認巴黎心甘情願讓無恥在那兒裝腔作勢。

sentences.english: If love, and so also willing, if do not love for children, autumn in vain also.
sentences.chinese: 假如愛，等上千年也心甘，若不愛，望眼將穿也徒然。

sentences.english: To be woulded by your own understanding of love, and to bleed willingly and joyfull.
sentences.chinese: 被自己對愛的體會所傷害，並且心甘情願地淌血。

sentences.english: That gonna make your leavings without regret and willing to do so.
sentences.chinese: 更讓你們走的無怨無悔，心甘情願。

sentences.english: Soon the royal cook came to kill the willing victim on the block.
sentences.chinese: 很快，御廚來宰殺砧板上心甘情願的犧牲者了。

definition: willingly and gladly (idiom)
delighted to (do sth, idiom)/perfectly happy to do/most willing to do
no complaints/to have no regrets
willingly
lit. as sweet as syrup (idiom, from Book of Songs); to endure hardship gladly/a glutton for punishment
willingness/would rather (agree to X than Y)
to offer one's life in sacrifice
lit. to work like an ox, to work like a horse; fig. to work extremely hard
see 死心塌地[si3 xin1 ta1 di4]
to meet death
to drift and live without purpose (idiom); to drag out an ignoble existence
to be hell-bent on/dead set on sth/unswerving
to have no regrets
to die without regret (idiom, from Analects)
would rather.../it would be better.../would prefer
not to refuse to (idiom)/not to hesitate to
